bestBHT.bht: The people listening to Jesus were astonished because of the authority with which he spoke. His words carried power and had a profound impact on their hearts. Not only did he claim authority, but he demonstrated it through his words and miraculous works. The authority of Jesus' teachings went beyond that of the scribes, and the people must have felt the weight and significance of his message.

Marvin Vincent: They were astonished [εξεπλησσοντο] . See on Matthew 7:28.
Philip Schaff: For his word was with authority.
They must have felt the authority itself.
He not only claimed power in His words, but exercised it with His words.
Archibald T. Robertson: Rest of the sentence as in Mark, which see, except that Luke omits "and not as their scribes" and uses οτ ην instead of ως εχων.
John Gill: he spake with great fervency, majesty, and authority
such power went along with the word, that it reached their hearts
he also confirmed it by powerful operations, by miraculous works

bhtAttempts.bht: The people listening to Jesus were astonished because of the authority with which he spoke. His words carried power and had a profound impact on their hearts. Not only did he claim authority, but he demonstrated it through his words and miraculous works. The authority of Jesus' teachings went beyond that of the scribes, and the people must have felt the weight and significance of his message.

The people listening to Jesus were amazed by his teachings, as they were astonished by the authority with which he spoke. This authority in his words not only came from his claim of power, but was demonstrated through his actions, which included powerful miracles. This combination of fervency, majesty, and authority in his teaching and the accompanying miracles had a profound impact on the hearts of those who heard him.

The people listening to Jesus in Luke 4:32 were astonished because of the authority with which he spoke. His words carried power and had a profound impact on their hearts. His teaching not only claimed authority, but it also demonstrated it through miraculous works. They witnessed firsthand the fervency, majesty, and authority in his speech, and they couldn't help but be amazed.

The people listened to Jesus speaking with great fervency, majesty, and authority, and they were astonished. His words not only claimed power, but they also demonstrated it through powerful operations and miraculous works. The authority with which Jesus spoke reached their hearts and left them amazed at the impact of his teaching.

The people were astonished as they listened to Jesus because of the authority and power in his words. His speech carried such great fervency, majesty, and authority that it had a deep impact on their hearts. Jesus not only claimed authority, but he also confirmed it by performing powerful operations and miraculous works. The authority with which he spoke reached their hearts and left them in awe of his teaching.
